title: Constitution and Structure of Government

vocab.definition: The supreme law of the United States
Dividing government power among three branches
Each branch of government can limit the others' power

teachingNotes: Explain the three branches and their functions. Show how checks and balances prevent any branch from becoming too powerful.

sample.question: What is the supreme law of the United States?
What is separation of powers?
expectedAny: dividing government power among three branches

sample.question: What are checks and balances?
expectedAny: each branch can limit others' power

sample.question: Why divide government into three branches?
How many branches of government are there?

truefalse.question: The Constitution divides government power among three branches. (True or False)
The Constitution is the supreme law of the United States. (True or False)
All government power belongs to one branch. (True or False)
Checks and balances prevent any branch from becoming too powerful. (True or False)
The legislative branch enforces laws. (True or False)
Congress is part of the legislative branch. (True or False)
The President is part of the executive branch. (True or False)
Separation of powers divides government into four branches. (True or False)
The judicial branch interprets laws. (True or False)
Each branch can limit the power of the other branches. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What is the supreme law of the United States?
What is the system that prevents any branch from becoming too powerful?
How many branches of government does the Constitution create?

choices.text: Giving all power to one branch

multiplechoice.question: What prevents one branch from having too much power?

fillintheblank.question: Each branch limiting the others' power is called _____ and balances.
The supreme law of the United States is the _____.
Dividing government power among three branches is called _____ of powers.
_____ is the law-making body of the legislative branch.
The government is divided into _____ branches.
Checks and _____ prevent any branch from becoming too powerful.

shortanswer.question: What are the three branches of government?
Why is the Constitution important?
expectedAny: It is the supreme law establishing government structure and protecting rights
It establishes the government and guarantees freedoms
It is the highest law defining how government works

shortanswer.question: How do checks and balances work?
expectedAny: Each branch can limit the power of the other branches
Branches check each other to prevent too much power
One branch can stop another from abusing power

shortanswer.question: What does the legislative branch do?
expectedAny: The legislative branch writes and approves legislation

shortanswer.question: What does the executive branch do?
expectedAny: It enforces laws through the President
The President carries out and enforces laws
The executive branch executes and enforces legislation

shortanswer.question: What does the judicial branch do?
expectedAny: It interprets laws through the courts
Courts decide what laws mean and if they are constitutional
The judicial branch interprets and applies laws

shortanswer.question: Why did the founders separate government powers?
expectedAny: To prevent tyranny and abuse of power
To stop any one branch from having too much power
To protect against government becoming too powerful

shortanswer.question: How does separation of powers protect freedom?
expectedAny: It divides power so no one controls everything
Separating powers prevents total control by one group
Division of power stops abuse and protects rights

shortanswer.question: What is the role of Congress?
expectedAny: Congress makes laws and represents the people
It is the legislative body that creates laws
Congress writes and passes legislation for the nation

shortanswer.question: How do the three branches work together?
expectedAny: They cooperate while checking and balancing each other
Branches work together but can limit each other's power
They share governing responsibilities with built-in controls
